properties.desc:
WATER ALERT: Next southbound water may be the Rodriguez fire tank in 32.7 miles. Check the water report for current information.

Barrel Spring, trough, shade, campsites [the spring source is 330 ft southbound on the PCT, then take the unmarked trail W, uphill 150 feet].

Watch for Poison Oak in the Barrel Spring area.

properties.name: WRCS0219
properties.desc:
The Whitewater Preserve is a hiker-friendly conservation preserve 6/10 mile E of the PCT at the site of an old trout farm. The preserve has running water, shade, toilets, a wading pool, and free camping for PCT hikers. PCT hikers who arrive after the ranger station closes should camp in the open grass area S of the Ranger Station. Check in with the ranger in the morning if staying more than one night.
-
No fires, smoking or alcohol.
-
Preserve phone: 760-325-7222
Website: www.wildlandsconservancy.org

properties.name: WR620
properties.desc:
Willow Spring, 1.6 miles N of PCT, pond, trough. WATER ALERT: Next northbound water may be Joshua Tree Spring] in 43.7 miles!! Next water southbound may be Landers Camp in 11.1 miles.
-----
Willow Spring can be reached as a 3.2 mile alternate bypassing 1.9 miles of the PCT. Follow the unsigned gully at PCT mile 620 [wooden PCT posts and Carsonite PCT markers are on either side of this gully] for 1.4 miles N to unpaved Dove Spring Canyon Rd [SC103]. The gully is mostly easy walking, but does have 2 or 3 short boulder scrambles that some hikers will find uncomfortable. After reaching SC103, walk right [SE] for 2/10 mile to reach Willow Spring. From WR620 continue 1.6 miles SE on SC103 to rejoin the PCT at mile 621.9. Skillful navigators can walk cross country east toward WR620 2/10 mile before the gully reaches SC103, shortening the alternate by about 4/10 mile. It can be difficult to find the correct point to exit the gully before reaching SC103 because your view is blocked in the gully.

properties.name: WA0751
properties.desc:
Chicken Spring Lake outlet, in dry years the outlet may be dry but the lake will have water.
-----
Water is usually plentiful in the Sierra Nevada sections of the Pacific Crest Trail. Water sources listed here were all checked in July and again late August 2012 (a very dry year). PCT hikers entering the Sierra earlier in the season will find more water sources that what is listed on Halfmile apps or maps.

properties.desc: Creek 3/10 mile S of PCT on paved Quincy-LaPorte Road.

properties.name: WA1234
properties.desc: Alder Spring (800 feet off trail) trail junction, campsite nearby.

properties.name: WACS1247
properties.desc: Middle Fork Feather River, steel bridge, campsites on N shore.

properties.name: WA1250
properties.desc: Bear Creek, footbridge, large campsite, water.

properties.name: WA1263
properties.desc: A small stream called Big Creek.

properties.name: WA1277
properties.desc: Grouse Spring trail junction (spring is 1/10 mile off trail).

properties.name: WA1279
properties.desc: Seasonal spring. Watch for POISON OAK as you descend to Belden.

properties.name: WACS1226
properties.desc: Seasonal East Hopkins Seep, small campsite nearby.

properties.name: WA1224B
properties.desc: West Branch of Bear Trap Creek. East Branch 3/10 mile south may be better water.

properties.name: WA1224
properties.desc: East Branch of Bear Trap Creek

properties.name: WACS1221
properties.desc: Seasonal W Branch Nelson Creek, campsite.

properties.name: WA1214
properties.desc: Trail junction to Little Jamison Creek, 200 feet off-trail.

properties.name: WA1214B
properties.desc: Piped spring 1/10 mile E of PCT

properties.name: WA1239
properties.desc: Black Rock Spring, 3/10 mile S of Fowler Peak Trailhead along trail

properties.name: WA1242
properties.desc: Small N Fowler Creek, 1/10 mile S of PCT down short trail,

properties.name: WACS1290
properties.desc: William's Cabin site, campsite, small creek nearby.

properties.name: WA1311
properties.desc: Trail junction to a spring, 1/3 mile off-trail.

properties.name: WA1313
properties.desc: Spring, 3/10 mile west of the PCT.

properties.name: WA1328
properties.desc: Wooden footbridge over seasonal part of Soldier Creek, often dry.

properties.name: WACS1338
properties.desc: North Fork Feather River, footbridge, campsites.

properties.name: WA1339
properties.desc: Domingo Spring trail junction, spring is 3/10 mile off-trail.

properties.name: WACS1350
properties.desc: Summit Lake trail junction, trail side creek, several campsites.

properties.name: WA1366
properties.desc: Unpaved road, water 1/10 mile west of the trail.

properties.name: WA1404
properties.desc: Small creek. WATER ALERT: Next southbound water may be Subway cave in 29.4 miles.

properties.name: WA1405C
properties.desc: Pass near a lake. WATER ALERT: Next northbound water may be Burney Falls State Park in 11.3 miles.

properties.name: WA1413
properties.desc: Rim of the Lake Spring trail junction (1/4 mile off-trail).

properties.name: WACS1416
properties.desc: Burney Falls State Park Headwaters Group Campground, reservation from State Park required, $35 fee, outhouse, picnic tables, trash cans. [Camping in the $5/night hiker/biker campsites in the main campground NE of mile 1416.5 is the preferred hiker option].

properties.name: WA1416
properties.desc: Hiker bridge over Burney Creek (usually dry).

properties.name: WACS1291
properties.desc: Campsites at Myrtle Flat, small stream nearby.

properties.name: WACS1316
properties.desc: Seasonal Carter Creek, 1/2 mile N of PCT, campsites nearby.

properties.name: WA1375
properties.desc: Subway Cave, water fountain, outhouse, paved parking area nearby. WATER ALERT: Next northbound water may be the creek in 29.4 miles.

properties.name: WA1405B
properties.desc: Crystal Lake Fish Hatchery, 300 feet E of trail, water.

properties.name: BrittonDam
properties.desc: PCT crosses Lake Britton Dam on a paved road.

properties.name: WACS1422
properties.desc: Cross Rock Creek on a wood bridge. Good water, but only a few small campsites nearby.

properties.name: WA1445
properties.desc: Headwaters of Moosehead Creek, better water 4/10 mile back.

properties.name: WA1456
properties.desc: Gold Creek trail junction, creek is 2/10 mile off trail.

properties.name: WACS1468
properties.desc: Ash Camp Campground, outhouse, water from nearby creek, unpaved road.

properties.name: WA1469
properties.desc: McCloud River, large wooden bridge. Watch for Poison Oak near the McCloud River.

properties.name: WA1482
properties.desc: Squaw Valley Creek, Squaw Valley trailhead trail junction nearby.

properties.name: WA1498B
properties.desc: Cross a bridge over a river.

properties.name: WA1498C
properties.desc: Cross another bridge over a river.

properties.name: WA1505B
properties.desc: West Fork of Sulphur Creek. The east fork is often better.

properties.name: WA1524
properties.desc: Picayune Spring trail junction. Spring is 800 feet off-trail.

properties.name: WACS1529
properties.desc: Porcupine Lake trail junction. Lake is 2/10 mile W of PCT.

properties.name: WA1583
properties.desc: Spring, 100 yards E of the PCT on a jeep road.

properties.name: WACS1588
properties.desc: Seasonal creek below Statue Lake, several campsites.

properties.name: WACS1591
properties.desc: Campsites at Paynes Lake, 100 yards W of PCT.

properties.name: WACS1621
properties.desc: Creek near Marble Valley Cabin [locked], campsites, Canyon Creek Trail junction

properties.name: WA1639
properties.desc: Cold Spring Creek, a large creek.

properties.name: WA1640
properties.desc: Grider Creek, 1st crossing, wooden footbridge (bridge was completely burnt in Nov 2014).

properties.name: WA1641
properties.desc: Grider Creek, 2nd crossing, wooden footbridge (bridge was burnt & broken in half but passable on foot, Nov. 2014).

properties.name: WACS1647
properties.desc: Grider Creek, 4th crossing near campground, steel footbridge, good swimming just N of bridge. Walk through the campground to start of 6.4 mile roadwalk to Seiad Valley.

properties.name: WA1653
properties.desc: Highway crosses the Klamath River on a large highway bridge.

properties.name: WA1605
properties.desc: Cub Bear Spring, small spring 2/10 mile E of PCT.

properties.name: WA1618
properties.desc: Cold Spring, 3/10 mile S of PCT, 270 ft elevation drop.

properties.name: WACS1632
properties.desc: Buckhorn Spring, small unmarked spring 150 feet W of the PCT in a meadow NW of the large three-forked tree, campsite nearby.

properties.name: WA1659
properties.desc: Lookout Spring, flowing from iron pipe.

properties.name: WA1668
properties.desc: Piped Cook and Green Pass spring

properties.name: WACS1694
properties.desc: Sheep Camp Spring, campsites, and unpaved road nearby.

properties.name: WA1678
properties.desc: Reeves Ranch Springs, 9/10 mile S of PCT.

properties.name: WA1683
properties.desc: Mud Springs, 2/10  mile north of PCT mile 1692.4.
